text: Kate Walsh (1 March 1947 – 24 April 2007) was an Irish Progressive Democrats politician and community activist from Celbridge, County Kildare. In 2002 she was nominated by the Taoiseach as a member of Seanad Éireann. Walsh was elected to Kildare County Council at the 1999 local elections, when she stood as an independent and won over one-and-a-half quotas on the first count. She later joined the Progressive Democrats (PDs), and stood unsuccessfully as a PD candidate for Dáil Éireann in the Kildare North at the 2002 general election. She was unsuccessful again at the by-election in 2005. Walsh was Mayor of Celbridge from 1982 to 2007. She died on 24 April 2007 from complications related to diabetes, after a long illness. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Local councillors in County Kildare Category:Members of the 22nd Seanad Category:21st-century women members of Seanad Éireann Category:People from Celbridge Category:Politicians from County Laois Category:Politicians from County Kildare Category:Progressive Democrats senators Category:20th-century women politicians Category:Nominated members of Seanad Éireann
title: Kate Walsh (politician)
